page.title: 01Levisham Moor Area
page.content: Basdically the block has a flattish and forested western half divided from the eastern higher heather covered levisham moor by Pickering Beek, along which runs north yorkshire moors railway. The forests are mainly conifer plantations, mainly cattle and sheep grazing. The only residents live ina few farms and are concerned with farming and forestry. The vehicular access is limited to dirt tracks mainly usedd for the forestry industry, but the scenery, especially around Lewisham Moor, is spectacular so the area is much visited by tourists, espically on foot from Newton Dale area or Hole of Horum. The moorland area is used for sheep grazing and grouse shooting may have been a use.
